alert.note: Alert for Kootenai, Cabinet Region; Lower Clark Fork Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 06 at 1:27PM MST until January 10 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches for valleys, 3 to 6 inches for Lookout Pass. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 12 inches for valley. 2 to 3 feet possible for Lookout Pass and the higher terrain. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph causing blowing and drifting snow and low visibility over mountain passes. * WHERE...I-90 Lookout Pass to Haugan, Highway 56 Bull Lake Road, Highway 37 Eureka to Libby, Highway 2 Kalispell to Libby, Evaro Hill, Highway 200 Thompson Falls to Plains, Highway 93 Eureka to Whitefish, and Highway 200 Trout Creek to Heron. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to 11 AM MST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Monday afternoon through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible Monday night into Wednesday morning. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Kootenai, Cabinet Region; Lower Clark Fork Region
